titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Michael Johnson Papers, 1881-1995 05656
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Special Collections Library faculty/staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-27 15:40:59 -0400.

change.item: As part of bulk updates, Lexy deGraffenreid added date expression, added description rules, updated finding aid title, and updated preferred citation

did.abstract: Michael Johnson worked as an organizer for the International Ladies' Garment Workers Union ( ILGWU) (1934-1955), becoming a labor education director (1955-1965), before joining the Pennsylvania AFL-CIO and the Pennsylvania Public Utilities Commission.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Penn State University Libraries catalog via the link above. Archival collections may be housed in offsite storage. For materials stored offsite, please allow 2-3 business days for retrieval.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: For information on accessing this collection please contact the Special Collections Research Services Unit at ul-spcolref@lists.psu.edu.

bioghist.head: Biographical or Historical Note
bioghist.p: Michael Johnson was born Michael Sussman in New York on 10 May 1912. Soon thereafter his family moved to Detroit, but around 1922 they returned to New York. While in high school he took the nom de plume Michael Johnson, and later he made that his legal name. After graduating from high school at the age of 16, he studied at Columbia University, but lack of money obliged him to drop out and take a job in Harlem as a presser in a coat factory, where he organized workers and a strike. In 1932 he married Sulamith Cohen; they had two daughters. For two decades, 1934 to 1955, Johnson worked an organizer, a district manager, and a director for the International Ladies' Garment Workers Union (ILGWU) in the northeastern region of Pennsylvania. He was education director for the Pennsylvania Federation of Labor (1955-1960) and then returned to the ILGWU as its education director (1960-1965). Johnson served as executive vice president of the Pennsylvania AFL-CIO (1965-1975) and then finished his career as a member of the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission (1975-1985), where he was renowned as a fiery advocate of consumer rights. He died in Philadelphia on 17 October 1995.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Michael Johnson Papers, 5656, Eberly Family Special Collections Library, Pennsylvania State University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is not processed. It primarily documents his service on the Pennsylvania Public Utilities Commission from 1975 to 1985 and the Pennsylvania AFL-CIO from 1965 to 1975.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the Michael Johnson Papers documents his service on the Pennsylvania Public Utilities Commission from 1975 to 1985. There are also papers from his term as executive vice president of the Pennsylvania AFL-CIO from 1965 to 1975, and biographical materials, photographs, and a musical composed by Johnson for the International Ladies' Garment Workers Union (1950).

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creators of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.
